info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas...
Rio Grande River Near San Benito affecting Cameron County.
Rio Grande River At Lower Brownsville affecting Cameron County.
For the Rio Grande River...including Falcon Dam, Below Falcon Dam, Roma, Rio Grande City, Los Ebanos, Anzalduas Dam, Progreso, San Benito, Lower Brownsville...elevated river levels are forecast.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Rio Grande River near San Benito.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 55.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding reaches into the lowest sections of the flood plain inside the levees with no significant damage
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM CDT Friday the stage was 46.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 44.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 53.9 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 44.0 feet. - Flood stage is 55.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
